description: Speaking in Atlanta Friday, Vice President Harris called tougher abortion laws “immoral” and slammed Republicans for what she called “longstanding neglect” around maternal mortality.
title: Harris says strict abortion laws lead to ‘predictable’ suffering for women

description: Three years ago, the cigarette giant acquired Vectura, a British pharmaceutical firm that makes asthma inhalers, raising health groups’ ire. Now, it’s selling the business for almost $200 million.
title: Philip Morris sells asthma inhaler company, citing ‘unwarranted opposition’ to its goals

description: The nasal spray option could encourage more people who have fears of doctors or needles to inoculate themselves against the flu.
title: No needles required: The FDA approves an at-home flu vaccine

description: The acting director of the Secret Service also cited “complacency” from others, as well as over-reliance on mobile devices and flaws in advance planning.
title: The Secret Service admits failures in Butler, Pa., Trump shooting

description: Republicans advanced the ballot hand-counting measure over the opposition of Georgia’s Republican secretary of state and attorney general and dozens of local election officials.
title: Georgia's Republican-led election board OKs controversial rule to hand-count ballots

description: The series of explosions that rocked Lebanon this week, killing dozens and wounding thousands, has prompted debate among legal experts on international humanitarian law.
title: Did exploding pagers attack on Hezbollah in Lebanon violate international law?

description: Three Mile Island, the Pennsylvania power plant that was the scene of the worst commercial nuclear accident in American history, will reopen and sell power to Microsoft.
title: Three Mile Island nuclear plant will reopen to power Microsoft data centers

description: In a speech to the Israeli-American Council, Trump described himself as Israel's "protector" and warned Jewish voters against voting for Vice President Harris.
title: Trump tells Jewish voters they have 'no excuse' for supporting Harris

description: The attack came hours after Hezbollah fired 140 rockets at northern Israel and follows this week's deadly explosions of pagers and walkie-talkies carried by Hezbollah members.
title: Israel fires an airstrike in Lebanon's capital in the latest fighting with Hezbollah

description: The court’s action upheld a decision of the Nevada Supreme Court.
title: Supreme Court rejects Green Party's appeal to put Jill Stein on Nevada ballot

description: New York Magazine said Nuzzi's relationship with a former subject violates its conflicts of interest standards. She said the relationship "was never physical," but apologized for not disclosing it.
title: Magazine writer Olivia Nuzzi is on leave over an alleged relationship with RFK Jr.

description: NPR's national podcasting contest for college students is now open for entries. Submit for a chance to win the $5,000 grand prize. Deadline is January 10.
title: Announcing NPR's fourth annual College Podcast Challenge

description: Rat and human lives have long intersected, but there's little relatively little research about them. Thanks to advances in genomics and paleoarcheology mean a lot more study may be on the horizon.
title: A “golden age” of rat research may be here. What the often unwanted companions can teach us about us

description: Emma and Rogelio Torres reminisce about how unlikely a pairing they were when they first met as migrant farmworkers in Arizona. They met in the 80s near Yuma — with love the last thing on their minds.
title: 2 former migrant farmworkers reflect on their journey together

description: More pregnant women are being diagnosed with dangerously high blood pressure, which risks the life of the parent and child. Montana is one of the states improving screening and treatment.
title: Deadly high blood pressure during pregnancy is on the rise
